benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/accounts/payments - Trigger a payment using the account external key

covered: POST Method: Valid Payload scenarios covered (TC01–TC03) with 201 status and a valid Payment object in response
POST Method: Optional parameters and headers supported (TC02, TC04, TC05) including controlPluginName and pluginProperty
POST Method: Boundary testing covered (TC22 minimal values, TC21 large payload, TC23 partial input)
POST Method: Validation scenarios covered (TC07, TC08, TC09, TC10, TC11, TC18)
POST Method: Not-found and empty-database scenarios (TC07, TC20)
POST Method: Gateway/processing error handling covered (TC12, TC13, TC14, TC15, TC16)
gaps: Duplicate submission / idempotency handling not covered
403 Forbidden authorization scenario not tested (only 401 Unauthorized covered)
Rate limiting / throttling behavior tests not present (e.g., 429)
Caching behavior for POST responses (ETag/Cache-Control) not tested
Internal server error scenario (500) not explicitly tested
Additional plugin/dependency edge cases beyond abortPlugin (e.g., missing plugin, conflicting plugin settings) not explored
Additional security attack vectors beyond malicious payload (e.g., SQLi, XSS in other fields) not tested
recommendations: Add idempotency/duplicate submission tests (e.g., using an idempotency key) to verify proper handling of repeated POSTs
Add 403 Forbidden authorization tests to cover insufficient permissions scenarios
Introduce rate limiting tests (429) and caching tests (ETag/Cache-Control) for POST responses where applicable
Introduce an explicit 500 Internal Server Error test to validate handling of unexpected server failures
Expand plugin-related tests to cover more edge cases and dependency failures
Augment security testing with broader attack vectors beyond a malicious payload (e.g., injection attempts in various fields)
